entry.title: Taxonomy of Transaction Fees in Smart Contracts
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the intricacies of incentivizing miners to prioritize a transaction within a blockchain network. The initial example provided lacked clarity, leading to confusion about how transaction acceleration could be achieved through direct incentives to miners. To rectify this misunderstanding, a more detailed mechanism was proposed, highlighting the use of explicit fee outputs in transactions directed at individual miners or mining pools. This method involves appending a specific script to the transaction, exemplified by pseudocode `100 op_csv op_checksigverify`. This approach aims to make the incentive for the miner clear, thereby increasing the likelihood of the transaction being included in the blockchain more swiftly. The conversation emphasizes the need for precision and clarity when discussing technical solutions in the blockchain space, especially regarding transaction handling and miner incentives.
